interestingcomments.content: Carsten, the lens throat moulding is integrated with half of the battery housing as this (not very good picture) shows. It's also coated with an anti-reflective black flocking on the part that becomes the lens throat, so I would be concerned about disturbing that. The plastic is quite thin as well, so I expect any attempt to remove material is going to end in disaster! --img--  For orientation, if you remove the battery from the camera, you can see the bottom shape with the two screws attaching it to the front casting. To the right is the lens throat and here you can see the cut out which allows access to the rangefinder adjustment through the bottom of the camera.
